text: Your day is a classroom; open a page and a moment will teach you.
Begin with one line: 'Today I noticed...'
Observe the ordinary—the steam from coffee, a bus stop bell, a quiet ache.
Write what you felt, not what you think you should feel.
If words stumble, describe the scene first; feelings can arrive later.
Journaling isn't perfect; it's your mind learning to listen.
Try tonight—one honest line, no filters.
Share your line or your takeaway in the comments, and reflect together.
